Class VigenereCipher

  • Object
    • VigenereCipher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cipher

    public class VigenereCipher
extends Object
implements Cipher
    The VigenereCipher class is a Cipher that uses a simplified polyalphabetic substitution cipher. In this version, the following assumptions are true:
    • plaintext is limited to lower-case ASCII-alphabet letters only (i.e., no numbers, no whitespace, no punctuation).
    • the key is also limited to the same restrictions as the plaintext.
    • the number of characters in the key is at least 1 and has no maximum limit.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VigenereCipher

        public VigenereCipher(String key)
        Creates a VigenereCipher object.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to be used to encrypt and decrypt. It contains only lower-case ASCII alphabet letters. No error-checking or handling is done to verify that the input is correct.

    • Method Detail

      • dumpArray

        private void dumpArray(int[] array,
                         String text)
        Prints out the specified text, followed immediately by the (comma-delimited) contents of the array.
        Parameters:
        array - The array of ints that is printed.
        text - This is printed at the start of the line.

      • stringToIntArray

        private int[] stringToIntArray(String text)
        Converts a string into an int array where the values are within the range 0...25. The values are matched, in order, to the characters in the string. For example, the integer 0 is matched to the letter 'a' and 25 is matched to and 'z'.
        Parameters:
        text - A plain text string consisting of only lower-case ASCII letters.
        Returns:
        An array that is the same length as the text string, and contains the associated value, in order, of each of the letters in the input string.

      • intArrayToString

        private String intArrayToString(int[] encodedText)
        Converts an array of integers with values in the range 0...25 into a string with characters in the range a...z. The individual letters are ordered exactly as the corresponding integer values. For example, the value 0 in index position i of the array, matches an 'a' as the first letter in the string.
        Parameters:
        encodedText - An array of integers with values between 0 and 25.
        Returns:
        A simple string of lower-case letters (no spaces, no punctuation) where the letter in index position i of the string corresponds to the integer value at index position i in the array.

      • encrypt

        public String encrypt(String plaintext)
        Encrypts a string using a simplified Vigenere cipher. All text is limited to lower-case ASCII letters a...z
        Specified by:
